newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-AUSTRALIAN Q2 PRIVATE WAGES FELL 0.1 PCT.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-AUSTRALIAN Q2 PRIVATE WAGES FELL 0.1 PCT.

text.p: Private sector average weekly ordinary time earnings (AWOTE) fell 0.1 percent in the three months to May for a rise of 2.5 percent on the year, the Australian Bureau of Statistics said.
Public sector AWOTE rose 1.6 percent in the quarter to be up 7.2 percent over the previous 12 months.
Final AWOTE data for adults employed full time was revised to a rise of 0.3 percent from 0.5 percent, giving an annual rise of 3.5 percent.
